title: Nothing Headphone (1)'s price in Europe leaks
description: Nothing is getting into the over-ear headphone business. It will unveil the Headphone (1) on July 1 at its launch event where it will also make the Phone (3) official. Both the phone and the headphones will be offered in the US officially, and a past rumor told us to expect the Nothing Headphone (1) to be priced at $299. But what about Europe? Specifically, the Eurozone. If you live there you are surely used to a price like $299 magically transforming into €399 or even €449, so you may have been expecting something similar here. But according to a new rumor, you'd be wrong. The...
excerpt: It's gotten a tiny bit more expensive for the US since the last rumor. Nothing is getting into the over-ear headphone business. It will unveil the...
text: Nothing is getting into the over-ear headphone business. It will unveil the Headphone (1) on July 1 at its launch event where it will also make the Phone (3) official. Both the phone and the headphones will be offered in the US officially, and a past rumor told us to expect the Nothing Headphone (1) to be priced at $299. But what about Europe? Specifically, the Eurozone. If you live there you are surely used to a price like $299 magically transforming into €399 or even €449, so you may have been expecting something similar here. But according to a new rumor, you'd be wrong. The Nothing Headphone (1) will allegedly go for €299. In the UK, it will be £299, and in the US this new source claims it will actually be $309, $10 more than what the last leak said. The device will apparently be available in white and black in Europe and the UK, and in grey and black in the US. Specs are still unclear, but the Headphone (1) has been developed in partnership with KEF, so sound quality should be high. We also expect ANC, a transparency mode, and a very Nothing design language of course. Source (in French)
html:
Nothing is getting into the over-ear headphone business. It will unveil the Headphone (1) on July 1 at its launch event where it will also make the Phone (3) official. Both the phone and the headphones will be offered in the US officially, and a past rumor told us to expect the Nothing Headphone (1) to be priced at $299.

But what about Europe? Specifically, the Eurozone. If you live there you are surely used to a price like $299 magically transforming into €399 or even €449, so you may have been expecting something similar here. But according to a new rumor, you'd be wrong.

The Nothing Headphone (1) will allegedly go for €299. In the UK, it will be £299, and in the US this new source claims it will actually be $309, $10 more than what the last leak said. The device will apparently be available in white and black in Europe and the UK, and in grey and black in the US.

Specs are still unclear, but the Headphone (1) has been developed in partnership with KEF, so sound quality should be high. We also expect ANC, a transparency mode, and a very Nothing design language of course.

Source (in French)
